snippet: Ask tenant leaders about Mayor Bill de Blasio and they say so far so good. Many landlords, though, say they are just bracing themselves for the next hit.
abstract: New York City landlords decry series of actions by Mayor Bill de Blasio that have had strong effect on their business, including raising water and sewer rates, engineering skimpy rent increases and maintaining watch list of landlords who harass tenants; bad blood is likely to thicken in 2015 as city's rent laws come up for renewal and de Blasio pursues plan to wrest rent regulation from state so that city can make laws stricter.
lead_paragraph: Ask tenant leaders about Mayor Bill de Blasio and they say so far so good. Many landlords, though, say they are just bracing themselves for the next hit.

headline.main: Landlords Say de Blasio Ignores Their Plight
headline.print_headline: Landlords Say de Blasio Ignores Their Plight
